intro: Bunchosia montana, commonly known as the mountain bunchosia, is a shrub native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, clustered flowers. It typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid conditions. Bunchosia montana is often used in traditional medicine for its potential health benefits.
